quote-source: The Economist, Tales of the unexpected: The glories and agonies of India’s central planners. Feb 18, 2012.
quote-text: Yet some things about [India’s Seventh Five Year Plan] have the capacity to surprise today. The prefaceâs author, Manmohan Singh, went on to lead the 1991 reforms and is now prime minister. The body behind it, the Planning Commission, is still alive and will soon launch its 12th plan for the five years beginning in April. It is the most powerful organ in India that would not be invented if it did not already exist. It is run by a bureaucratic rock star and, weirdly, is a bastion of liberal views in a government that has fallen out of love with reform.
